IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ADVOCACY, REPRESENTATION & EDUCATION FOR HOSPITALS AND HEALTHCARE ORGANIZATIONS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: CHA'S MISSION IS TO ADVANCE THE HEALTH OF INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES BY LEADING, REPRESENTING, AND SERVING HOSPITALS AND THEIR RELATED HEALTHCARE ORGANIZATIONS.
IRS990.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES ADVOCACY, REPRESENTATION, EDUCATION, AND DISSEMINATION OF INFORMATION TO ITS MEMBERS AND THE PUBLIC. THE ASSOCIATION ORGANIZES AND SUPPORTS OVER 40 MEETING GROUPS FOR 27 HOSPITALS AND OVER 100 OTHER INSTITUTIONAL MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BELOW IS AN EXCERPT FROM FOOTNOTE 2 OF THE CONSOLIDATED AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR THE CONNECTICUT HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION, INCORPORATED AND AFFILIATES. THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS FASB ASC 740, INCOME TAXES. UNDER THE ASSET AND LIABILITY METHOD OF FASB ASC 740, DEFERRED TAX ASSETS AND LIABILITIES ARE RECOGNIZED FOR THE FUTURE TAX CONSEQUENCES ATTRIBUTABLE TO DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT CARRYING AMOUNTS OF EXISTING ASSETS AND LIABILITIES AND THEIR RESPECTIVE TAX BASIS. DEFERRED TAX ASSETS AND LIABILITIES ARE MEASURED USING ENACTED TAX RATES EXPECTED TO APPLY TO TAXABLE INCOME IN THE YEARS IN WHICH THOSE TEMPORARY DIFFERENCES ARE EXPECTED TO BE RECOVERED OR SETTLED. UNDER FASB ASC 740, THE EFFECT ON DEFERRED TAX ASSETS AND LIABILITIES OF A CHANGE IN TAX RATES IS RECOGNIZED IN THE PERIOD THAT INCLUDES THE ENACTMENT DATE. DNS FILES A CONSOLIDATED INCOME TAX RETURN WITH CHAIS, CHIME AND CHIMENET. THE PROVISION FOR INCOME TAX EXPENSE HAS BEEN ALLOCATED TO THE INDIVIDUAL ENTITIES AS IF THE CORPORATIONS EACH FILED A STANDALONE TAX RETURN. THE ORGANIZATION ACCOUNTS FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS IN ACCORDANCE WITH PROVISIONS OF FASB ASC 740 THAT PRESCRIBE A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD AND MEASUREMENT ATTRIBUTE FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF A TAX POSITION TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN ON A TAX RETURN. FASB ASC 740 ADDRESSES THE DETERMINATION OF WHETHER TAX BENEFITS CLAIMED OR EXPECTED TO BE CLAIMED ON A TAX RETURN SHOULD BE RECORDED IN THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. FASB ASC 740 PERMITS THE RECOGNITION OF TAX POSITIONS THAT MEET A "MORE LIKELY THAN NOT" THRESHOLD, BASED ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION. THE ORGANIZATION'S POLICY IS TO RECOGNIZE INTEREST AND PENALTIES RELATED TO INCOME TAXES AS A COMPONENT OF INTEREST EXPENSE AND THE PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES, RESPECTIVELY. AS OF APRIL 30, 2022 AND 2021, THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT RECORD ANY PENALTIES OR INTEREST ASSOCIATED WITH UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS. ALL TAX YEARS OF THE ORGANIZATION FROM 2019 FORWARD ARE OPEN AND SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE, HOWEVER, THERE ARE CURRENTLY NO EXAMINATIONS PENDING OR IN PROGRESS.
CHA DOES NOT GIVE GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS, THEY ONLY GIVE DONATIONS TO 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATOIN FOR USE IN THEIR EXEMPT PURPOSE.

LoansBtwnOrgInterestedPrsnGrp.LoanPurposeTxt: PREMIUMS ON SUPPLEMENTAL LIFE INSURANCE POLICY

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHA (THE FILING ORGANIZATION) IS THE COMMON PAYMASTER FOR FIVE AFFILIATED ORGANIZATIONS AND, AS SUCH, FILES A FORM W-3 FOR EACH ORGANIZATION USING CHA'S FEDERAL EMPLOYER IDENTIFICATION NUMBER (EIN). IN THE TAX YEAR 2021, 26 OF THE 55 TOTAL EMPLOYEES WERE DIRECTLY EMPLOYED BY CHA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS AN ASSOCIATION OF CONNECTICUT HOSPITALS AND HEALTHCARE ORGANIZATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS AN ASSOCIATION OF CONNECTICUT HOSPITALS AND HEALTHCARE ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE REPRESENTATIVES COMPRISE THE GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DECISIONS OF THE GOVERNING BODY ARE SUBJECT TO APPROVAL BY THE ASSEMBLY OF THE ASSOCIATION'S MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER REVIEWS ALL INFORMATION IN THE FORM 990, WHICH IS PROVIDED TO THE FINANCIAL OVERSIGHT COMMITTEE FOR THEIR REVIEW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL BOARD MEMBERS AND EMPLOYEES ARE COVERED UNDER THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS DISCLOSED TO THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD AND MADE A MATTER OF RECORD BY (A) AN ANNUAL DISCLOSURE PROCEDURE, (B) AN UPDATE WHEN AN INDIVIDUAL'S CIRCUMSTANCES CHANGE BETWEEN ANNUAL DISCLOSURES, AND (C) A DISCLOSURE WHEN A MATTER COMES BEFORE THE BOARD THAT INVOLVES AN INTEREST COVERED BY THIS POLICY. ANY BOARD MEMBER OR EMPLOYEE HAVING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, SHALL, AS APPROPRIATE TO THE CIRCUMSTANCES, ABSTAIN FROM VOTING OR USING PERSONAL INFLUENCE ON THAT MATTER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION RECOMMENDATIONS FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S CEO, OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT, UTILIZING DATA FROM COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS, AND ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD AND DOCUMENTED IN THE APPLICABLE MINUTES. THE LAST COMPENSATION REVIEW WAS IN DECEMBER OF 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
CONSULTING FEES 172,692. PROFESSIONAL FEES 716,457. OUTSIDE PRINTING 533.
PENSION CHANGES OTHER THAN NET PERIODIC BENEFIT COST 318,892.
THERE ARE NO CHANGES FROM PRIOR YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHA SHARES STAFF WITH FOUR AFFILIATED ORGANIZATIONS FOR ADMINISTRATIVE, HUMAN RESOURCES, ACCOUNTING, OPERATIONS AND INFORMATION SYSTEMS FUNCTIONS AND ALLOCATES THE COST. INCLUDED IN THESE COST ALLOCATIONS ARE STAFF EXPENSES (SALARY AND FRINGE BENEFITS) AND RELATED NON-STAFF EXPENSES (SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT, PROFESSIONAL FEES, ETC.)
